title: Global vs Local Scope Practice
instructions: Practice working with global and local scope, including reading and modifying global variables.
solution:
# Global counter
counter = 0

def increment_counter():
    """Increment global counter by 1"""
    global counter
    counter += 1

def reset_counter():
    """Reset global counter to 0"""
    global counter
    counter = 0

def get_counter():
    """Return current counter value"""
    return counter

# Global configuration
config = {"debug": False, "timeout": 30}

def enable_debug():
    """Set debug to True in global config"""
    global config
    config["debug"] = True
hints: Use the global keyword before modifying a global variable
Reading global variables doesn't require the global keyword
You can modify dictionary contents without global keyword, but reassigning needs it
description: Practice working with global and local scope, including reading and modifying global variables.
